metadata.title: CVE-2019-10149 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Exim versions 4.87 to 4.91 (inclusive). Impropervalidation of recipient address in deliver_message() function in/src/deliver.c may lead to remote command execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.3
exim4-base - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.3
exim4-config - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.3
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.3
exim4-daemon-light - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.3
eximon4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.86.2-2ubuntu2.3').
